abstract.text: A container template that displays and manages other templates, presenting them as tabs.

inlineContent.text: is a container template that displays a collection of other templates, where each template occupies a single tab in the tab bar. At runtime, use
to determine the maximum number of tabs that your tab bar can display.
, provide an array of templates for the tab bar to display. CarPlay treats the array’s templates as root templates, each with its own navigation hierarchy. When a tab bar template is the
of your app’s interface controller and you use the controller to add and remove templates, CarPlay applies those changes to the selected tab’s navigation hierarchy.
You can’t add a tab bar template to an existing navigation hierarchy, or present one modally. Instead, use
to set the tab bar as your app’s root template.
Use a transactional approach when making changes to the tab bar. Retrieve the current set of templates using the
property. Add, remove, reorder, or make appearance changes to one or more of the array’s templates. For example, use the
property to update a template’s tab title, or set
to add an indicator to a template’s tab. Then call the
method and pass it the updated array. CarPlay commits those changes and updates the tab bar.
When the user selects a tab, the template calls the
method on its delegate, which is an object you provide that conforms to the

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
The methods that templates use to provide buttons for the navigation bar.
A template that displays and manages a grid of items.
The root template in the navigation hierarchy.
Sets the root template of the navigation hierarchy.
A template that displays and manages a list of items.
A container template that displays and manages other templates, presenting them as tabs.
The object that acts as the template’s delegate.
Creates a tab bar template that displays the provided root templates as tabs.
The maximum number of tabs that the template can display.
The currently selected template in the tab bar.
The tab bar’s templates.
Adds, removes, reorders, or updates the tab bar’s templates.
The methods an object implements to act as the delegate for a tab bar template.
Tells the delegate when the tab bar selects the specified template.
An abstract base class for interface templates.
An indicator you use to call attention to the tab.
A short title that describes the content of the tab.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
